title.rendered: Legacy Capital Project Continues To Enhance Our School Buildings

content.rendered:
The ongoing legacy capital project work, approved by voters in 2020, continues to enhance our school buildings and improve our learning environments.

Over the summer, essential renovations were successfully completed at both Dorothy Nolan and Greenfield Elementary Schools, focusing on enhancing the main offices and installing security vestibules at the entryways. Additionally, Greenfield Elementary School underwent a parking lot redesign to enhance traffic safety.

In every school building, numerous classrooms have been equipped with updated flexible furniture designed to accommodate various teaching styles and student seating preferences.

Looking ahead, cafeteria renovations at Saratoga Springs High School and Dorothy Nolan Elementary School are scheduled for completion during the winter. Additionally, the revamped high school fitness center is expected to be available to students at the start of the second semester.
